trans-unit.source: Trains a Bayesian recommender using the Matchbox algorithm
trans-unit.target: Trains a Bayesian recommender using the Matchbox algorithm

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Train Matchbox Recommender</ui> module to train a recommendation model based on the Matchbox recommender engine.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Train Matchbox Recommender</ui> module to train a recommendation model based on the Matchbox recommender engine.

trans-unit.source: The recommendation algorithm is based on the <externalLink><linkText>Matchbox model</linkText><linkAlternateText>MSR site</linkAlternateText><linkUri>http://research.microsoft.com/projects/matchbox/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The recommendation algorithm is based on the <externalLink><linkText>Matchbox model</linkText><linkAlternateText>MSR site</linkAlternateText><linkUri>http://research.microsoft.com/projects/matchbox/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Train Matchbox Recommender</ui> module reads a dataset of user-item-rating triples and, optionally, some user and item features.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Train Matchbox Recommender</ui> module reads a dataset of user-item-rating triples and, optionally, some user and item features.

trans-unit.source: It returns a trained Matchbox recommender.
trans-unit.target: It returns a trained Matchbox recommender.

trans-unit.source: You can use the trained model to create recommendations and find related items, by using the <link xlink:href="55544522-9a10-44bd-884f-9a91a9cec2cd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Score Recommender</link> module.
trans-unit.target: You can use the trained model to create recommendations and find related items, by using the <link xlink:href="55544522-9a10-44bd-884f-9a91a9cec2cd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Score Recommender</link> module.

trans-unit.source: The main aim of a recommendation system is to recommend one or more "items" to "users" of the system.
trans-unit.target: The main aim of a recommendation system is to recommend one or more "items" to "users" of the system.

trans-unit.source: Examples of an item could be a movie, restaurant, book, or song.
trans-unit.target: Examples of an item could be a movie, restaurant, book, or song.

trans-unit.source: A user could be a person, group of persons, or other entity with item preferences.
trans-unit.target: A user could be a person, group of persons, or other entity with item preferences.

trans-unit.source: There are two principal approaches to recommender systems.
trans-unit.target: There are two principal approaches to recommender systems.

trans-unit.source: The first is the <legacyBold>content-based</legacyBold> approach, which makes use of features for both users and items.
trans-unit.target: The first is the <legacyBold>content-based</legacyBold> approach, which makes use of features for both users and items.

trans-unit.source: Users may be described by properties such as age and gender, and items may be described by properties such as author and manufacturer.
trans-unit.target: Users may be described by properties such as age and gender, and items may be described by properties such as author and manufacturer.

trans-unit.source: Typical examples of content-based recommendation systems can be found on social matchmaking sites.
trans-unit.target: Typical examples of content-based recommendation systems can be found on social matchmaking sites.

trans-unit.source: The second approach is <legacyBold>collaborative filtering</legacyBold>, which uses only identifiers of the users and the items and obtains implicit information about these entities from a (sparse) matrix of ratings given by the users to the items.
trans-unit.target: The second approach is <legacyBold>collaborative filtering</legacyBold>, which uses only identifiers of the users and the items and obtains implicit information about these entities from a (sparse) matrix of ratings given by the users to the items.

trans-unit.source: We can learn about a user from the items they have rated and from other users who have rated the same items.
trans-unit.target: We can learn about a user from the items they have rated and from other users who have rated the same items.

trans-unit.source: The Matchbox recommender combines collaborative filtering with a content-based approach.
trans-unit.target: The Matchbox recommender combines collaborative filtering with a content-based approach.

trans-unit.source: It is therefore considered a <legacyBold>hybrid recommender</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: It is therefore considered a <legacyBold>hybrid recommender</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: When a user is relatively new to the system, predictions are improved by making use of the feature information about the user, thus addressing the well-known "cold-start" problem.
trans-unit.target: When a user is relatively new to the system, predictions are improved by making use of the feature information about the user, thus addressing the well-known "cold-start" problem.

trans-unit.source: However, once you have collected a sufficient number of ratings from a particular user, it is possible to make fully personalized predictions for them based on their specific ratings rather than on their features alone.
trans-unit.target: However, once you have collected a sufficient number of ratings from a particular user, it is possible to make fully personalized predictions for them based on their specific ratings rather than on their features alone.

trans-unit.source: Hence, there is a smooth transition from content-based recommendations to recommendations based on collaborative filtering.
trans-unit.target: Hence, there is a smooth transition from content-based recommendations to recommendations based on collaborative filtering.

trans-unit.source: Even if user or item features are not available, Matchbox will still work in its collaborative filtering mode.
trans-unit.target: Even if user or item features are not available, Matchbox will still work in its collaborative filtering mode.

trans-unit.source: More details on the Matchbox recommender and its underlying probabilistic algorithm can be found in the relevant research paper: <externalLink><linkText>Matchbox: Large Scale Bayesian Recommendations Recommendations</linkText><linkUri>http://research.microsoft.com/pubs/79460/www09.pdf</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: More details on the Matchbox recommender and its underlying probabilistic algorithm can be found in the relevant research paper: <externalLink><linkText>Matchbox: Large Scale Bayesian Recommendations Recommendations</linkText><linkUri>http://research.microsoft.com/pubs/79460/www09.pdf</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the <externalLink><linkText>Machine Learning Blog</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/</linkUri></externalLink> has an article titled <externalLink><linkText>Recommendations Everywhere</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2014/07/09/recommendations-everywhere.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> that provides a high-level introduction to recommendation algorithms.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the <externalLink><linkText>Machine Learning Blog</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/</linkUri></externalLink> has an article titled <externalLink><linkText>Recommendations Everywhere</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2014/07/09/recommendations-everywhere.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> that provides a high-level introduction to recommendation algorithms.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure Train Matchbox Recommender
trans-unit.target: How to Configure Train Matchbox Recommender

trans-unit.source: You can configure <ui>Train Matchbox Recommender</ui> by using these parameters:
trans-unit.target: You can configure <ui>Train Matchbox Recommender</ui> by using these parameters:

trans-unit.source: This parameter determines how many (latent) traits are learned for each user and item.
trans-unit.target: This parameter determines how many (latent) traits are learned for each user and item.

trans-unit.source: The higher the number of traits, the more accurate the predictions will typically be; however, training will be slower.
trans-unit.target: The higher the number of traits, the more accurate the predictions will typically be; however, training will be slower.

trans-unit.source: The number of traits usually lies in the range 2 - 20.
trans-unit.target: The number of traits usually lies in the range 2 - 20.

trans-unit.source: The Matchbox recommender is trained using a message-passing algorithm, which can iterate multiple times over the input data.
trans-unit.target: The Matchbox recommender is trained using a message-passing algorithm, which can iterate multiple times over the input data.

trans-unit.source: The higher this number, the more accurate the predictions; however, training will be slower.
trans-unit.target: The higher this number, the more accurate the predictions; however, training will be slower.

trans-unit.source: Usually, the number of iterations is in the range 1 - 10.
trans-unit.target: Usually, the number of iterations is in the range 1 - 10.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Train Matchbox Recommender</ui> expects three inputs, with only the first input being required.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Train Matchbox Recommender</ui> expects three inputs, with only the first input being required.

trans-unit.source: The first input must be a dataset of <legacyBold>user-item-rating triples</legacyBold>, one in each row of the associated dataset.
trans-unit.target: The first input must be a dataset of <legacyBold>user-item-rating triples</legacyBold>, one in each row of the associated dataset.

trans-unit.source: The first column must contain user identifiers, the second column must contain item identifiers, and the third column contains the user-item pair.
trans-unit.target: The first column must contain user identifiers, the second column must contain item identifiers, and the third column contains the user-item pair.

trans-unit.source: The difference between the minimum and the maximum rating values in the dataset must be less than 100, and ideally is not greater than 20.
trans-unit.target: The difference between the minimum and the maximum rating values in the dataset must be less than 100, and ideally is not greater than 20.

trans-unit.source: The <database>Restaurant ratings</database> dataset provided in Azure Machine Learning Studio (click <ui>Saved Datasets</ui> and then <ui>Samples</ui>) demonstrates the expected format:
trans-unit.target: The <database>Restaurant ratings</database> dataset provided in Azure Machine Learning Studio (click <ui>Saved Datasets</ui> and then <ui>Samples</ui>) demonstrates the expected format:

trans-unit.source: From this sample, you can see that a single user has rated two separate restaurants.
trans-unit.target: From this sample, you can see that a single user has rated two separate restaurants.

trans-unit.source: To get more information about the user, you can join this dataset with the <database>Restaurant customer data</database> dataset, using the <database>userID</database> column as key.
trans-unit.target: To get more information about the user, you can join this dataset with the <database>Restaurant customer data</database> dataset, using the <database>userID</database> column as key.

trans-unit.source: To get more information about the restaurants, join the <database>Restaurant feature data</database> dataset on the <database>placeID</database> column.
trans-unit.target: To get more information about the restaurants, join the <database>Restaurant feature data</database> dataset on the <database>placeID</database> column.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the required dataset of user-item-rating triples, <ui>Train Matchbox Recommender</ui> can take two optional inputs:
trans-unit.target: In addition to the required dataset of user-item-rating triples, <ui>Train Matchbox Recommender</ui> can take two optional inputs:

trans-unit.source: The second input can be used to provide user features.
trans-unit.target: The second input can be used to provide user features.

trans-unit.source: The dataset of user features must contain the identifiers of users in its first column.
trans-unit.target: The dataset of user features must contain the identifiers of users in its first column.

trans-unit.source: The remaining columns contain the features that describe the users.
trans-unit.target: The remaining columns contain the features that describe the users.

trans-unit.source: For an example, see the <database>Restaurant customer data</database> dataset, provided in Azure Machine Learning Studio (click <ui>Saved Datasets</ui> and then <ui>Samples</ui>).
trans-unit.target: For an example, see the <database>Restaurant customer data</database> dataset, provided in Azure Machine Learning Studio (click <ui>Saved Datasets</ui> and then <ui>Samples</ui>).

trans-unit.source: A typical set of user features looks like this:
trans-unit.target: A typical set of user features looks like this:

trans-unit.source: The third input can be used to provide item features.
trans-unit.target: The third input can be used to provide item features.

trans-unit.source: The dataset of item features must contain item identifiers in its first column.
trans-unit.target: The dataset of item features must contain item identifiers in its first column.

trans-unit.source: The remaining columns then contain the corresponding features describing the items.
trans-unit.target: The remaining columns then contain the corresponding features describing the items.

trans-unit.source: For an example, see the <database>Restaurant feature data</database> dataset, provided in Azure Machine Learning Studio (click <ui>Saved Datasets</ui> and then <ui>Samples</ui>).
trans-unit.target: For an example, see the <database>Restaurant feature data</database> dataset, provided in Azure Machine Learning Studio (click <ui>Saved Datasets</ui> and then <ui>Samples</ui>).

trans-unit.source: A typical set of item features (in this case, the item is a restaurant) might look like this:
trans-unit.target: A typical set of item features (in this case, the item is a restaurant) might look like this:

trans-unit.source: Note that missing values of a feature will be replaced with the mode of its non-missing values.
trans-unit.target: Note that missing values of a feature will be replaced with the mode of its non-missing values.

trans-unit.source: Note further that all user and item features will be rescaled to have unit length, so that their maximum absolute value is 1.
trans-unit.target: Note further that all user and item features will be rescaled to have unit length, so that their maximum absolute value is 1.

trans-unit.source: No translation is applied to the feature values, so as to maintain their sparsity.
trans-unit.target: No translation is applied to the feature values, so as to maintain their sparsity.

trans-unit.source: For examples of how recommendation models are used in Azure Machine Learning, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how recommendation models are used in Azure Machine Learning, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Movie recommender sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525276</linkUri></externalLink> demonstrates how to train, evaluate, and score using a recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Movie recommender sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525276</linkUri></externalLink> demonstrates how to train, evaluate, and score using a recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: To download a paper that describes the algorithm in detail, click this link on the <externalLink><linkText>Microsoft Research site</linkText><linkAlternateText>MSR site</linkAlternateText><linkUri>http://research.microsoft.com/pubs/79460/www09.pdf</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To download a paper that describes the algorithm in detail, click this link on the <externalLink><linkText>Microsoft Research site</linkText><linkAlternateText>MSR site</linkAlternateText><linkUri>http://research.microsoft.com/pubs/79460/www09.pdf</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Currently, the lower bound of Matchbox's memory footprint is <math>16 * N * (4 * T + 2 * R)</math> bytes, where <math>N</math> refers to the number of user-item-rating triples in the training dataset, <math>T</math> to the number of latent traits, and <math>R</math> to the difference between the minimum and maximum rating (in the training dataset).
trans-unit.target: Currently, the lower bound of Matchbox's memory footprint is <math>16 * N * (4 * T + 2 * R)</math> bytes, where <math>N</math> refers to the number of user-item-rating triples in the training dataset, <math>T</math> to the number of latent traits, and <math>R</math> to the difference between the minimum and maximum rating (in the training dataset).

trans-unit.source: The size of a serialized Matchbox recommender model is approximately <math>16 * T * (U * R + I + X + Y)</math> bytes, where <math>U</math> refers the number of users, <math>I</math> to the number of items, <math>X</math> to the number of user features, and <math>Y</math> to the number of item features.
trans-unit.target: The size of a serialized Matchbox recommender model is approximately <math>16 * T * (U * R + I + X + Y)</math> bytes, where <math>U</math> refers the number of users, <math>I</math> to the number of items, <math>X</math> to the number of user features, and <math>Y</math> to the number of item features.

trans-unit.source: Ratings of items by users, expressed as a triple (User, Item, Rating)
trans-unit.target: Ratings of items by users, expressed as a triple (User, Item, Rating)

trans-unit.source: Dataset containing features that describe users
trans-unit.target: Dataset containing features that describe users

trans-unit.source: Dataset containing features that describe items
trans-unit.target: Dataset containing features that describe items

trans-unit.source: Specify the number of traits to use with the recommender
trans-unit.target: Specify the number of traits to use with the recommender

trans-unit.source: Specify the maximum number of iterations to perform while training the recommendation model
trans-unit.target: Specify the maximum number of iterations to perform while training the recommendation model

trans-unit.source: For a list of all module errors, see <link xlink:href="60822377-da7a-40b8-aec7-d185d1509344" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Module Errors</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of all module errors, see <link xlink:href="60822377-da7a-40b8-aec7-d185d1509344" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Module Errors</link>.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if number of selected columns in input dataset does not equal to the expected number.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if number of selected columns in input dataset does not equal to the expected number.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if multiple feature vectors were provided for a given user or item.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if multiple feature vectors were provided for a given user or item.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if input dataset is not valid.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if input dataset is not valid.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if no features were provided for a given user or item.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if no features were provided for a given user or item.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if more than one rating exists for a given user-item pair.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if more than one rating exists for a given user-item pair.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs in the case when there are no user features or items for Matchbox recommendations.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs in the case when there are no user features or items for Matchbox recommendations.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
